numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that Indonesia is very optimistic for adults.
2. I notice that Indonesia is very optimistic for young adults.
3. I notice that in the US more young adults are optimistic than adults.
4. I notice that Mali is not very optimistic for adults.
5. I notice that Mali is not very optimistic for young adults.
6. Around 30 percent of young adults in Mali are optimistic.
7. Around 25 percent of adults in Mali are optimistic.
8. I wonder about people who are 25-39 years old.
9. I wonder why the opinions of people who are 25-39 years old are not included.
10. I wonder why Indonesia is so optimistic.
11. I wonder whether belief causes the optimism in Indonesia.
12. I wonder whether schooling causes the optimism in Indonesia.
13. I wonder whether something else causes the optimism in Indonesia.
14. I wonder how the interviewers decided which countries to interview.
15. I wonder why some countries are not on the graph.
16. Thailand is a country.
17. China is a country.
18. I wonder why Thailand is not on the graph.
19. I wonder why China is not on the graph.
20. I wonder why young adults tend to be more optimistic than adults.
21. I wonder whether adults witnessed damage of the Earth.
22. I wonder whether adults contributed to damage of the Earth.
23. I wonder whether this experience causes adults to be less optimistic.
24. I wonder whether young adults have a more open mindset.
25. I wonder whether this mindset causes young adults to be more optimistic.
26. I wonder whether something else causes young adults to be more optimistic.
27. Adults in the US are not very optimistic compared to adults in some other countries.
28. Young adults in the US are rather optimistic.
29. I wonder why adults in the US are not very optimistic.
30. I wonder why young adults in the US are rather optimistic.
31. The headline is: Optimistic or Not About the Future?
